feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 9:24PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED SURF FROM POINT HOPE TO THE BERING STRAIT THROUGH MONDAY... Northwest winds 15 to 30 mph are expected through Monday along the coast south of Point Hope to the Bering Strait, causing elevated surf with minor beach erosion for north facing coastlines.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 9:24PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Thunderstorms This Evening... There are widely scattered thunderstorms with frequent lightning, brief heavy rain, and winds gusting to 35 mph this evening from east of Galena and McGrath. These thunderstorms should diminish about midnight.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Upper Kuskokwim Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 9:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Thunderstorms This Evening... There are widely scattered thunderstorms with frequent lightning, brief heavy rain, and winds gusting to 35 mph this evening along the Alaska Highway east of Dot Lake, in the Fortymile Country, and over the Tanana Valley west of Manley Hot Springs. These thunderstorms should diminish about midnight.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued August 13 at 12:24PM AKDT until August 14 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Near passes in the Eastern Alaska Range. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 AM AKDT Sunday.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 10:51PM MST until August 14 at 12:30AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE BACKBONE FIRE SCAR BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM MST SUNDAY FOR GILA AND YAVAPAI COUNTIES... At 1048 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that rain has ended over the Backbone Fire scar. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain fell earlier this evening and is likely producing flash flooding in Fossil Creek.
